database module¶

Module handling the application’s database operations.

class database.Database(csv_path=None, db_path='movies.db')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class managing SQLite database and data operations.

Parameters:

  • csv_path (str or None) – Path to the CSV file with movie data.

  • db_path (str) – Path to the SQLite database file.

create_connection()[source]¶

Creates a connection to the SQLite database.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – If connection to the database fails.

create_metadata_table()[source]¶

Creates the metadata table in the database.

create_movies_table()[source]¶

Creates the movies table in the database.

create_ratings_table()[source]¶

Creates the ratings table in the database.

create_tables()[source]¶

Creates all required tables in the database.

create_users_table()[source]¶

Creates the users table in the database.

get_all_movies_as_dataframe()[source]¶

Retrieves all movies as a DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame containing all movie data.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

get_genres_by_movie_id(movie_id)[source]¶

Retrieves genres for a movie by its ID.

Parameters:

movie_id (int) – Movie ID.

Returns:

String with comma-separated genres or None.

Return type:

str or None

get_movie_details(title)[source]¶

Retrieves detailed information about a movie.

Parameters:

title (str) – Movie title.

Returns:

Tuple containing movie data (id, title, genres, keywords, language, overview, companies, runtime, cast, director).

Return type:

tuple or None

insert_movies_data_if_needed()[source]¶

Inserts movie data into the database if not already present.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – In case of database insertion error.

load_data()[source]¶

Loads data from the CSV file into a DataFrame.

search_movies(query)[source]¶

Searches for movies based on the provided query.

Parameters:

query (str) – Search phrase for movie titles.

Returns:

List of matching movie titles.

Return type:

list

letterboxd_clone
